title: Skull fracture

fields.name: activity_restrictions
fields.label: Activity restrictions
fields.default: Avoid contact sport, heavy lifting, or activities with risk of head impact until cleared.

fields.name: followup_plan
fields.label: Follow-up plan
fields.default: Follow up with your GP or neurosurgery clinic within 7 days, or as arranged.

patientBody:
## Discharge advice

You were assessed in ED and diagnosed with a skull fracture{{#if fracture_description}} ({{fracture_description}}){{/if}}.

Home care:
- Rest and avoid alcohol or sedating medications unless prescribed.
- Keep any wounds clean and dry as directed.
- Pain relief: {{analgesia_plan}}

Activity restrictions:
{{activity_restrictions}}

{{#if on_blood_thinners}}Because you take blood thinners, return to ED immediately if you develop worsening headache, repeated vomiting, confusion, drowsiness, new bleeding, or if you hit your head again. Do not stop blood thinners unless your clinician tells you to.

{{/if}}Return to ED urgently if you develop:
- Worsening headache, repeated vomiting, or seizures
- Increasing confusion, drowsiness, or agitation
- Clear fluid or blood from the nose or ears
- New weakness, numbness, or vision changes

## Follow-up
{{followup_plan}}

{{/if}}## Discharge advice provided
Written head injury return precautions provided.

## Follow-up
